# Sequences

> Standard library math iterators for generating sequences.

<section class="usage">

## Usage

```javascript
var ns = require( '@stdlib/math/iter/sequences' );
```

#### ns

Standard library math iterators for generating sequences.

```javascript
var iterators = ns;
// returns {...}
```

The namespace contains the following functions for creating iterator protocol-compliant iterators:

<!-- <toc pattern="*"> -->

<div class="namespace-toc">

-   <span class="signature">[`iterFibonacci( [options] )`][@stdlib/math/iter/sequences/fibonacci]</span><span class="delimiter">: </span><span class="description">create an iterator which generates a Fibonacci sequence.</span>
-   <span class="signature">[`iterNonFibonacci( [options] )`][@stdlib/math/iter/sequences/nonfibonacci]</span><span class="delimiter">: </span><span class="description">create an iterator which generates a non-Fibonacci integer sequence.</span>

</div>

<!-- </toc> -->

</section>

<!-- /.usage -->

<section class="examples">

## Examples

<!-- TODO: better examples -->

<!-- eslint no-undef: "error" -->

```javascript
var objectKeys = require( '@stdlib/utils/keys' );
var ns = require( '@stdlib/math/iter/sequences' );

console.log( objectKeys( ns ) );
```

</section>

<!-- /.examples -->
